chapter.title: Compilation
chapter.para: Compilation is the process of transforming a Soya program to machine-executable code. A Soya program consists of one or more modules (). Each module is a stream of characters of the character set defined in the Unicode standard (www.unicode.org).

note.para: Although the Unicode standard defines several different encodings for characters, implementations are only required to support the UTF-8 encoding.

chapter.para: The compilation of a Soya program is divided into the following three conceptual phases:

listitem.para: Lexical analysis, which transforms each module of a program to a sequence of tokens.
Syntactic analysis, which translates every token sequence generated by lexical analysis to executable code.
